channel.title: Bored
channel.description: Ok i am bored as fick right now so i just had to post this. My freind is a genius.... I meen a real genius, his grades are always a+, his iq is 144, he can give the square root of any number given to him between one and 10000...wlel taht one isnt so great, he taught me how to do it 2... oh and the best of all, he got bored one day and learend the first 1000 numbers in pi...

item.title: Bored
item.dc:creator: @Hiaburi Hiaburi
item.description:
@Hiaburi wrote:

goatee:

STFU … this has to be one of the most useless pieces of spam on this site.

well i was bored and trying to procrastinate so i dont have to do homework, and i figured i would say that… its weird to, hes not a geek or nerd or whatever, hes more a jock then anything else… idk i just thought that memorized a thousand numbers for fun was kinda weird…

Read full topic

item.title: Bored
item.dc:creator: @BobDole81 BobDole81
item.description:
@BobDole81 wrote:

[quote=“Mr.Chris, post:3, topic:88390”][quote author=Hiaburi link=topic=129419.msg1254894#msg1254894 date=1178151368]
Ok i am bored as fick right now so i just had to post this. My freind is a genius… I meen a real genius, his grades are always a+, his iq is 144, he can give the square root of any number given to him between one and 10000…wlel taht one isnt so great, he taught me how to do it 2… oh and the best of all, he got bored one day and learend the first 1000 numbers in pi…
[/quote]

That’s pretty amazing, tbh. Unbelievable though I doubt any human being could ever memorize the first 1000 numbers of Pi.

Also, anyone could work out the square root of any number given with the correct formula.[/quote]

Google Daniel Tammet - he memorized the first 22,000 or so decimals of pi and recited it in like 15 hours if I remember correctly. Granted, he’s a savant so it didn’t have as much to do with “ordinary” intelligence (obviously, intelligence is involved, but just not what we’re used to :)).

Read full topic

That’s pretty amazing, tbh. Unbelievable though I doubt any human being could ever memorize the first 1000 numbers of Pi.

Also, anyone could work out the square root of any number given with the correct formula.[/quote]

yeah, i saw this program on channel 4 a while ago, this ‘mental’ man could memorize the first 2500 of Pi.

item.description:
@Mr.Chris wrote:

Hiaburi:

Ok i am bored as fick right now so i just had to post this. My freind is a genius… I meen a real genius, his grades are always a+, his iq is 144, he can give the square root of any number given to him between one and 10000…wlel taht one isnt so great, he taught me how to do it 2… oh and the best of all, he got bored one day and learend the first 1000 numbers in pi…

That’s pretty amazing, tbh. Unbelievable though I doubt any human being could ever memorize the first 1000 numbers of Pi.

Also, anyone could work out the square root of any number given with the correct formula.
